meanings.definition: A native or inhabitant of Scotland.
meanings.sent1: The scot wore a kilt and played the bagpipes.
meanings.sent2: Many scots celebrate Hogmanay with traditional customs.
meanings.sent3: The scot joked that he could find Nessie in his bathtub.
meanings.sent4: She was as proud as a scot standing atop Ben Nevis.
meanings.sent5: The scot's accent was as thick as a bowl of porridge.

meanings.definition: A portion or share of expenses or costs.
meanings.sent1: Each person paid their scot for the meal.
meanings.sent2: The scot for the party was split evenly among friends.
meanings.sent3: The scot for the trip was a bargain compared to the fun they had.
meanings.sent4: Her scot for the project was more than she expected.
meanings.sent5: He contributed his scot without hesitation.

meanings.definition: To pay a share of expenses or costs.
meanings.sent1: I will scot my part for the dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: She always scots her fair share when going out with friends.
meanings.sent3: He scotted for the movie tickets before anyone could protest.
meanings.sent4: They scot their dues promptly to avoid any issues.
meanings.sent5: Scotting for the repairs was the right thing to do.
